org.lunifera.runtime.utils.osgi.component

Class AbstractComponentWithCompendium

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lunifera.runtime.utils.osgi.component.AbstractComponentBasic
      • org.lunifera.runtime.utils.osgi.component.AbstractComponentWithCompendium
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractComponentExtender, AbstractComponentFactoryContributionHandler, AbstractComponentWhiteboard

    public abstract class AbstractComponentWithCompendium
extends AbstractComponentBasic
    An abstract class to be inherited by components that requires a logging, an event admin, preference and some others OSGi compendium services bounded at activation time.

    Unfortunately, OSGi DS Annotations don't support inheritance, so every DS annotation must be used inside concrete children classes.

    In order to facilitate developers life it was included in this abstract component 3 methods (a bindX(), a getX() and a unbindX()). Therefore, in order to use them children classes must override the correspondent bindX() method and apply the proper @Reference annotation.

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Cristiano Gavi√£o

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        protected final void activate(org.osgi.service.component.ComponentContext context)
                       throws ExceptionComponentLifecycle
        Method used by Declarative Service engine to activate this component.

        For concrete classes the activation process was divided in three parts sequentially called.
        The first method to be called is doBeforeActivateComponent(), then the main execution in doWhenActivateComponent() and to complete the activation process, doAfterActivateComponent().

        This separation will help add-ons developers to facilitate the end users life, creating abstract classes that implements the most important parts in its before and after methods.

        Overrides:
        activate in class AbstractComponentBasic
        Throws:
        ExceptionComponentLifecycle

      • defineEventsToBeTracked

        protected void defineEventsToBeTracked()
        A method where developer can define which events will be automatically tracked and properly handled by this component class.

        Developer must use the method trackEvent(PluggableEventTracker) to register an event to be tracked.

        It is aimed to be overridden by children concrete classes.

      • defineInnerServicesToBeTracked

        protected void defineInnerServicesToBeTracked()
                                       throws ExceptionComponentLifecycle
        A method where developer can define which services will be automatically tracked by this component class.

        Developer must use the method trackServicesWith(PluggableServiceTracker) to register a service to be tracked.

        To get an instance of those registered service just use the correspondent getXXX() method from this class.

        It is aimed to be overridden by children concrete classes but don't forget to call super.defineServicesToBeTracked().

        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.InvalidSyntaxException
        ExceptionComponentLifecycle

      • doRuntimeAnnotationsProcessing

        protected void doRuntimeAnnotationsProcessing()
                                       throws ExceptionComponentLifecycle
        This method is a hook that could be used to process the annotations tagged in the component class declaration.

        As this hook method will be called at the beginning of the activation procedure, values encountered here could be hold in class variables and used by other methods of the component.

        It is aimed to be overridden by children concrete classes.

        Parameters:
        annotations -
        Throws:
        Exception
        ExceptionComponentLifecycle

      • doRuntimePropertiesProcessing

        protected void doRuntimePropertiesProcessing(Dictionary<String,Object> properties)
        Do the processing of the properties passed for this component at runtime.

        This method is called in the beginning of the activation process.

        It is aimed to be overridden by children concrete classes.

        Parameters:
        properties -

        protected void doWhenActivateComponent()
                                throws ExceptionComponentLifecycle
        This method is called by the activate(ComponentContext) method in order to complete the activation of the child concrete component.

        It is aimed to be overridden by children concrete classes.

        Throws:

      • trackServicesWith

        protected final <T> PluggableServiceTracker<T> trackServicesWith(Class<T> serviceToTrack,
                                               String filter)
                                                      throws ExceptionComponentLifecycle
        Adds a service class to be tracked by this component.

        An instance of PluggableServiceTracker will be created for each interface.

        Parameters:
        serviceToTrack - the interface of the service to be tracked.
        filter - used to track for the service.
        Throws:
        ExceptionComponentLifecycle
